basics.name: Antoine Serre
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Creative software engineer with more than 9 years of experience in game development. Skilled at writing clear, efficient code that is easy to maintain and extend. Experienced working within small and big teams on various types of projects. Independent worker, able to work remotely or in-office as needed.

work.name: Unity
work.summary: Part of the Unity Games Solutions team providing customers with multi-disciplinary expertise of the Unity game engine.
highlights: Optimized the server performance and memory footprint of a small multiplayer RPG and reduced their AWS costs by 70% using build time custom tooling
Lead the UI effort for a greenfield mobile game project, including a brand new data-binding library with fully serializable state and live reload
Worked on a multi-year full rewrite of the *Dofus* MMORPG game client written in AS3 to Unity
Added native support for up to 8 controllers to the Unity engine using the Windows.Gaming.Input API for the game *Gang Beasts* to help achieve performance targets while keeping feature parity

work.name: Ubisoft
work.summary: Part of a small R&D editorial team promoting open-world systemic gameplay to production studios. It involved travelling abroad for missions (from 1 to 6 months).
highlights: Designed and implemented the fire, oil and poison systems in *Assassin's Creed: Origins*
Prototyped a spreading malware gameplay system for *Watch Dogs: Legion*
Consulted on systemic gameplay concepts for various projects, from general presentations to advanced design discussions and workshops
Developed a generic data analysis tool recording full sessions of gameplay in a memory compact, database friendly format. Used to compare worldlife metrics of several games
Prototyped navigation schemes in virtual reality with a focus on user experience and reduced motion sickness

work.name: Ubisoft
highlights: Developed innovative production tools based on projection mapping to help design the logic of open-world AAA games
Explored tools and techniques to improve mobile prototyping iteration speed

work.name: Spiders
highlights: Developed a real-time debugging tool for character animation blending
Added UI logic and integrated assets for the game *Bound by Flames*

work.name: Eugen Systems
highlights: R&D for an advanced physics-based simulation systems for vehicles in *Wargame: European Escalation*
Worked on procedural animations for the 300+ mechanical units in the game

projects.name: iota
projects.description: No-code toy game engine structured like a relational database, using array programming language concepts
highlights: Homoiconic function definition and column-major array layout for efficient parallel execution
Unified extendable visual editor for code and data with customizable inspectors
